item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, November 9, 2024 at 9:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. OpenCoder: Open Cookbook for Top-Tier Code Large Language Models (165 points | 25 comments)
2. Show HN: Jaws – a JavaScript to WASM ahead-of-time compiler (77 points | 36 comments)
3. Early Cascade Injection: From Windows process creation to stealthy injection (59 points | 8 comments)
4. Mergiraf: a syntax-aware merge driver for Git (281 points | 67 comments)
5. IronCalc – Open-Source Spreadsheet Engine (74 points | 28 comments)
6. Zig's (.{}){} Syntax (32 points | 8 comments)
7. Show HN: HTML-to-Markdown – convert entire websites to Markdown with Golang/CLI (211 points | 41 comments)
8. Scientist treated her own cancer with viruses she grew in the lab (291 points | 123 comments)
9. When machine learning tells the wrong story (26 points | 1 comment)
10. Texture-Less Text Rendering (155 points | 43 comments)
11. Automat: A tangible interface for virtual things (16 points | 2 comments)
12. Somebody moved UK's oldest satellite (35 points | 11 comments)
13. Trellis (YC W24) is hiring eng to turn documents into database ( | hide)
14. SVDQuant: 4-Bit Quantization Powers 12B Flux on a 16GB 4090 GPU with 3x Speedup (138 points | 43 comments)
15. Obtainium: Get Android App Updates Directly from the Source (133 points | 66 comments)
16. There aren't enough smart people in biology doing something boring (43 points | 33 comments)
17. HPV vaccination: How the world can eliminate cervical cancer (256 points | 101 comments)
18. Memories are not only in the brain, human cell study finds (158 points | 69 comments)
19. Ticketmaster’s attempt to game arbitration services fails (204 points | 55 comments)
20. The Saturn V FUELDRAULIC Gimbal System (1963) (30 points | 11 comments)
21. FrontierMath: A benchmark for evaluating advanced mathematical reasoning in AI (3 points | discuss)
22. A Brief History of Cyrix (53 points | 9 comments)
23. Cache Directory Tagging Specification (2004) (15 points | 6 comments)
24. Since the '60s, Ford has stored cars underground in a Kansas City cave (106 points | 32 comments)
25. Notes on Guyana (86 points | 79 comments)
26. Can humans say the largest prime number before we find the next one? (261 points | 119 comments)
27. Using Two ReMarkables (79 points | 40 comments)
28. Nikolai Fyodorov wanted to resurrect the dead to live among the stars (44 points | 17 comments)
29. Delta: A syntax-highlighting pager for Git, diff, grep, and blame output (545 points | 72 comments)
30. A CC-By Open-Source TTS Model with Voice Cloning (112 points | 21 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, November 9, 2024 at 9:15 PM UTC
